alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:01PM EDT until May 06 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following county, Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 501 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Covington, Norwood, Newport, Reading, North College Hill, Madeira, Milford, Deer Park, Dayton, Ludlow, Finneytown, Forestville, Mariemont, Terrace Park, Plainville, Rossmoyne, University of Cincinnati, Concorde Hills and Camp Dennison.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
